p: On the basis of antigenic differences, influenza A viruses are categorized into subtypes according to haemagglutinin and neuraminidase, the surface antigens, and influenza B viruses are separated into the Victoria and Yamagata lineages. Influenza A(H1N1)pdm09, influenza A(H3N2) and influenza B viruses co-circulate each year [ 3, 4].
